relation: "I was doctering for a while, with out my Mother and Dad knowing it."
"Two weeks after we bought the refrigerator I took sick."
"You could tell them that you sent me and you know I can act."
"It just seems impossible for me to get a job anywhere."
"I am a poor colored girl who thinks quite a lot of you."
"Without help I can go no further into the step of education."
pageTitle: Letters to Mrs. Roosevelt: Requests for Money
textBeforeTable: The Letters: Requests for Money 3 of 5 Some children asked Mrs. Roosevelt for specific sums of money, and described to her exactly how the money would be used.
